entry.title: Bioinformatics - Lecture 1 Fundamental Concepts of Bioinformatics
entry.content:
Bioinformatics Lecture 1

Fundamental Concepts of Bioinformatics

Central Dogma: DNA, RNA and proteins

HGP: Human Genome Project äººç±»åŸºå› ç»„è®¡åˆ’

-omics: ç»„å­¦

Bioinformatics:

  • Collection, processing & storage: computer scientist
  • Analysis & interpretation: biologist

â¡Bioinformatics is a combination of

  (1) mathematical sciences

  (2) computer sciences

  (3) life sciences

Main research area of bioinformatics:

  • Genome sequence assembly
  • Gene identification
  • Gene function prediction
  • Genetic polymorphism analysis
  • Gene evolution
  • mRNA structure prediction
  • Gene chip design
  • Gene chip data analysis
  • Disease related gene analysis
  • Protein sequence analysis
  • Protein family classification
  • Protein structure prediction
  • Study of protein folding
  • Metabolic pathway analysis
  • Transcriptional regulation mechanism
  • Protein chip design
  • Protein microarray data analysis
  • Drug design (Computer-Assisted Drug Design, CADD)
  • â€¦

Bioinformatics database:

  • Genomic database: EMBL, GenBank, DDBJ

  • Protein sequence database: SWISS-PROT, PIR

  • Protein sequence database: PDB

Three major gene database:

GenBank, EMBL Data Library, DDBJ (DNA Data Bank of Japan) â¡ Public free Available via Internet

KEGG: a collection of databases dealing with genomes, biological pathways, diseases, drugs, and chemical substances. ï¼ˆè‹±è¯­ï¼š(Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomesï¼Œä¸­æ–‡ï¼šäº¬éƒ½åŸºå› ä¸åŸºå› ç»„ç™¾ç§‘å…¨ä¹¦ï¼Œæ—¥è¯­ï¼šäº¬éƒ½éºä¼å­ã‚²ãƒãƒ ç™¾ç§‘äº‹å…¸ï¼‰(link)

Scientific journals: Nucleic Acid Research

The core of bioinformatics: sequence alignment

e.g. 1. Sequence alignment acquires strong algorithm background:

e.g. Gene identification

Example: prokaryotic gene regulation

e.g. Protein analysis

e.g. CADD

Classic bioinformatic software introduction

  • Multiple sequence alignment software: ClusterX
  • Phylogenetic tree software: MEGA
  • PCR primer design software: Primer Premier
  • Image processing software: Image J
  • Protein interaction website: STRING
  • Network building software: Cytoscape
  • Computer aided drug design software: moe

entry.title: A possible biosynthesis pathway of arctigenin in Arctium lappa L.
entry.content:
It is a potential pathway of arctigenin biosynthesis in _Arctium lappa L._. ,

â€‹ This assumption is based on:

[1] Chan, Y. S., Cheng, L. N., Wu, J. H., Chan, E., Kwan, Y. W., Lee, S. M., Leung, G. P., Yu, P. H., & Chan, S. W. (2011). A review of the pharmacological effects of Arctium lappa (burdock). Inflammopharmacology, 19(5), 245â€“254.

[2] Morimoto, K., & Satake, H. (2013). Seasonal alteration in amounts of lignans and their glucosides and gene expression of the relevant biosynthetic enzymes in the Forsythia suspense leaf. Biological & pharmaceutical bulletin, 36(9), 1519â€“1523.

[3] Ozawa, S., Davin, L. B., & Lewis, N. G. (1993). Formation of (âˆ’)-arctigenin in Forsythia intermedia. Phytochemistry, 32(3), 643-652.

â€‹ Due to the fact that caffeyl alcohol (zh: å’–å•¡é†‡) is abundant in _Actrium lappa L._, we set the substrate as caffeyl alcohol.
